intro: Tassadia berteroanum, commonly known as the Tassadia berteroanum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. Due to its unique appearance, it is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
